description: Automated database migration management with rollback capabilities, validation, and multi-environment support
author: JSONbored
features: Automated database migration detection and execution
Support for multiple database systems (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite)
Migration file integrity checking with checksums

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Check if it's a migration-related file
if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *migration* ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *schema* ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.sql ]]; then
  echo "ðŸ—ƒï¸ Database migration file detected: $FILE_PATH" >&2
  
  # Check for common migration frameworks
  if [ -f "package.json" ] && (grep -q "knex" package.json || grep -q "sequelize" package.json || grep -q "typeorm" package.json); then
    echo "ðŸ“¦ Node.js migration framework detected" >&2
    
    # Knex migrations
    if command -v npx &> /dev/null && npx knex --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
      echo "ðŸ”§ Running Knex migration status check..." >&2
      MIGRATION_STATUS=$(npx knex migrate:status 2>/dev/null || echo "No pending migrations")
      echo "ðŸ“Š Migration Status: $MIGRATION_STATUS" >&2
      
      # Check for pending migrations
      if echo "$MIGRATION_STATUS" | grep -q "pending"; then
        echo "âš ï¸ Pending migrations detected. Run 'npx knex migrate:latest' to apply them" >&2
      else
        echo "âœ… All migrations are up to date" >&2
      fi
      
    # Sequelize migrations
    elif command -v npx &> /dev/null && npx sequelize-cli --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
      echo "ðŸ”§ Sequelize CLI detected" >&2
      echo "ðŸ’¡ Run 'npx sequelize-cli db:migrate:status' to check migration status" >&2
      
    # TypeORM migrations
    elif command -v npx &> /dev/null && npx typeorm --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
      echo "ðŸ”§ TypeORM detected" >&2
      echo "ðŸ’¡ Run 'npx typeorm migration:show' to check migration status" >&2
    fi
    
  # Django migrations
  elif [ -f "manage.py" ]; then
    echo "ðŸ Django project detected" >&2
    if command -v python &> /dev/null; then
      echo "ðŸ”§ Checking Django migration status..." >&2
      python manage.py showmigrations --plan 2>/dev/null | tail -5 | head -3 || echo "ðŸ’¡ Run 'python manage.py showmigrations' to check status" >&2
    fi
    
  # Rails migrations
  elif [ -f "Gemfile" ] && grep -q "rails" Gemfile; then
    echo "ðŸ’Ž Rails project detected" >&2
    if command -v bundle &> /dev/null; then
      echo "ðŸ”§ Checking Rails migration status..." >&2
      bundle exec rails db:migrate:status 2>/dev/null | tail -5 || echo "ðŸ’¡ Run 'rails db:migrate:status' to check status" >&2
    fi
    
  # Raw SQL files
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.sql ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ“œ Raw SQL migration file detected" >&2
    
    # Check file size and complexity
    if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
      LINE_COUNT=$(wc -l < "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      echo "ðŸ“Š SQL file contains $LINE_COUNT lines" >&2
      
      # Check for potentially destructive operations
      if grep -i "DROP\|DELETE\|TRUNCATE" "$FILE_PATH" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "âš ï¸ WARNING: Potentially destructive SQL operations detected (DROP/DELETE/TRUNCATE)" >&2
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Consider creating a backup before executing this migration" >&2
      fi
      
      # Check for common patterns
      if grep -i "CREATE TABLE\|ALTER TABLE\|CREATE INDEX" "$FILE_PATH" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "ðŸ—ï¸ Schema modification statements detected" >&2
      fi
      
      if grep -i "INSERT\|UPDATE" "$FILE_PATH" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "ðŸ“ Data modification statements detected" >&2
      fi
    fi
  fi
  
  # General migration best practices reminder
  echo "ðŸ“‹ Migration Best Practices:" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Always backup database before running migrations" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Test migrations on development/staging first" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Ensure migrations are reversible when possible" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Use transactions for atomic operations" >&2
  
else
  echo "File $FILE_PATH is not a migration file, skipping analysis" >&2
fi

exit 0

useCases: Automated database schema evolution in development workflows
CI/CD pipeline integration for deployment migrations
